title: Berith
data:
**Berith, the Red Horseman** is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Ritual, seal and taboo](#Ritual.2C_seal_and_taboo)

- [2 Mark](#Mark)

- [3 Benefits](#Benefits)

- [4 As a monster](#As_a_monster)

  - [4.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [4.2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Ritual, seal and taboo

Berith's seal must be drawn around one of the following: [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves") with the [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") of "riding gloves", [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") with the randomized appearance of "riding boots", a [saddle](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle"), a [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow"), or a [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance"). Alternatively, a character can wear a blessed [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") with the appearance of a "silver ring" on their left hand while [chatting](/wiki/Chat "Chat") to the seal.

To remain bound to Berith, the character must not kill [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet"), including former pets that have turned feral.

## Mark

A character that has Berith bound appears drenched in blood, as does any [steed](/wiki/Steed "Steed") they are currently riding. The blood can be easily seen from a distance, but will take the form of enamel if wearing torso armor ([body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor"), [shirt](/wiki/Shirt "Shirt") and/or a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak")), [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves"), [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots"), and a [helm](/wiki/Helm "Helm") - the blood on the steed cannot be disguised unless the character dismounts.

## Benefits

While Berith is bound, the following effects occur:

- Berith grants skill in [lances](/wiki/Lance "Lance"), sabers, riding, and [shields](/wiki/Shield "Shield").

- Berith also increases a character's base attack bonus to full (i.e. +1 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") per level, as with martial [roles](/wiki/Role "Role")), and health [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration") occurs twice as fast.

- A character's mount (if any) benefits from some of their resistances:

  - [Fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")
  - [Cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance")
  - [Shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance")
  - [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
  - [Acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance")
  - [Sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance")
  - [Disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance")
  - [Stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance")
  - [Drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance")
  - [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance")
  - [Death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance") (e.g. from [Ose](/wiki/Ose "Ose"))
  - [Immunity to sickness](/wiki/Immunity_to_sickness "Immunity to sickness")

Berith's active powers are as follows:

- **Blood Mercenary**: Fires an invisible beam in a chosen direction that deals 5 dice of non-elemental damage to target monsters. Using this power requires a character to have enough [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") in open inventory: the amount required is determined when rolling for damage per target, but *before* that damage is applied, and is rerolled for each target monster - if there is not enough gold present, the attack fails and nothing else happens.
- **Sow Discord**: Monsters on the level attack each other for an amount of turns equal to a roll of the character's spirit die + 5.

His passive powers are as follows:

- **Blood-price**: Monsters may drop gold in places of their [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse").

In notdNetHack, **Berith**, C, also appears as a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that can be summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder"). He is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") [centaur-like](/wiki/Centaur_\(monster_class\) "Centaur (monster class)") monster that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and will seek out gold and other items to pick up.

Berith has a weapon attack, a [kick](/wiki/Kick "Kick") attack, and a spiritual blade attack that deals more damage against monsters with blood - spiritual blade attacks bypass the [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") of the target's worn armor, are not considered contact attacks, and always hit insubstantial targets (e.g. [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade")).

Like many summoned spirits, Berith cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame").

### Generation

Berith is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Berith is [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") [plate mail](/wiki/Plate_mail "Plate mail") fitted to his body shape, a long sword, some gold, and the uncursed **Crown of Berith**, an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet") made of [gold](/wiki/Gold_\(material\) "Gold (material)") that can be safely enchanted to +7.

Berith [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

### Strategy

**Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.** They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

[x][ ]

- Strategy
- Role spoiler

Berith's armor will put him at an effective AC of 0, and his artifact helm makes him immune to an Illithanachronounbinder's brain-eating attacks. He hits hard and fast in melee and will be able to deal severe damage to most Illithanachronounbinder races, with only [ents](/index.php?title=Ent_\(starting_race\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ent (starting race) (page does not exist)") being immune to blood-based bonus damage.

If Berith is killed after being summoned, he can be encountered again in the [Void](/index.php?title=Void\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Void (page does not exist)"), a branch accessed by opening the high [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") of [Ilsensine the Fallen](/wiki/Ilsensine_the_Fallen "Ilsensine the Fallen") as an Illithanachronounbinder using the [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") effect of [The Elder Cerebral Fluid](/wiki/The_Elder_Cerebral_Fluid "The Elder Cerebral Fluid"). Berith is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving").

## Encyclopedia entry

From Baal: God, and Berith: Covenant. The name of a deity worshiped in ancient Canaan, reviled as a demon by the early Israelites, and later the Christians.

Ritual, seal and taboo

Berith's seal must be drawn around one of the following: gloves with the randomized appearance of "riding gloves", boots with the randomized appearance of "riding boots", a saddle, a saber, a long sword, a bow, or a lance. Alternatively, a character can wear a blessed ring with the appearance of a "silver ring" on their left hand while chatting to the seal.

  • Berith grants skill in lances, sabers, riding, and shields.
  • Berith also increases a character's base attack bonus to full (i.e. +1 to-hit per level, as with martial roles), and health regeneration occurs twice as fast.
  • A character's mount (if any) benefits from some of their resistances:
    • Fire resistance

    • Poison resistance
    • Acid resistance
    • Sleep resistance
    • Disintegration resistance
    • Stoning resistance
    • Drain resistance
    • Magic resistance
    • Death resistance (e.g. from Ose)
    • Immunity to sickness

  • Blood Mercenary: Fires an invisible beam in a chosen direction that deals 5 dice of non-elemental damage to target monsters. Using this power requires a character to have enough gold in open inventory: the amount required is determined when rolling for damage per target, but before that damage is applied, and is rerolled for each target monster - if there is not enough gold present, the attack fails and nothing else happens.

Berith:

  • likes gold.
  • can pick up weapons and food.

  • never leaves a corpse.
  • cannot be tamed.

In notdNetHack, Berith, C, also appears as a monster that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is a strong centaur-like monster that can be seen via infravision and will seek out gold and other items to pick up.

Berith has a weapon attack, a kick attack, and a spiritual blade attack that deals more damage against monsters with blood - spiritual blade attacks bypass the AC and DR of the target's worn armor, are not considered contact attacks, and always hit insubstantial targets (e.g. shades).

Like many summoned spirits, Berith cannot be tamed.

Generation

Berith is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal polymorph.

Berith is generated with plate mail fitted to his body shape, a long sword, some gold, and the uncursed Crown of Berith, an artifact helmet made of gold that can be safely enchanted to +7.

Berith does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role. They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

Berith's armor will put him at an effective AC of 0, and his artifact helm makes him immune to an Illithanachronounbinder's brain-eating attacks. He hits hard and fast in melee and will be able to deal severe damage to most Illithanachronounbinder races, with only ents being immune to blood-based bonus damage.

If Berith is killed after being summoned, he can be encountered again in the Void, a branch accessed by opening the high altar of Ilsensine the Fallen as an Illithanachronounbinder using the invoke effect of The Elder Cerebral Fluid. Berith is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him nonliving.
